results.title: The Jolly swagman. [Parts 1 and 2]
results.creator_credit: David Baker, Roger Mirams and Pacific Films
results.brief_description: A summer’s day in Ten Town. Young Gary (Gary Grey) is feeling dejected and neglected by his friends and decides to go for a walk. He comes across a billabong in the bush and meets a swagman (Ken Goodlet). Suddenly he is transported back in time to the 1860’s. With his record player in hand and with the help of the song Waltzing Matilda, the swagman’s life is changed.

results.title: The John Thomas show
results.creator_credit: Bruce Permezel, Denise Eriksen, ABC-TV (Australia) and Beyond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Problem with men”.
Bryan Dawe and John Clarke introduce the delicate areas of impotence and testicular cancer. Testicular cancer can be treated early if picked up through self examination - if left, removal is the only option. Men who have had a testicle removed discuss if, and how the surgery and treatment has affected their lives. They also postulate on why self examination does not receive the same coverage that women’s self examination does. Meanwhile, impotence sufferers and their partners describe their experiences and medical professionals go through the pros and cons of vacuum pumps, self injection and where impotence treatment is heading. We are also shown how to examine for testicular abnormalities.

results.title: The John Marsden video
results.creator_credit: Mark Waters, Christine McCaul Gleitzman and Insight Profile
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Insight profile”.
Author John Marsden discusses the theories behind writing a successful novel. Using examples from his own work, he explores the different writing styles he uses in his own works, the way the characters think, and the motivating factors which make the characters come to life on the page. Also includes discussion on sentence structure, imagery, and how to select the right words to captivate the reader.

results.title: The Job for you
results.creator_credit: Alan Anderson, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Commonwealth Employment Service established shortly after World War II, aims at finding a job suitable for the person and a person suitable for the job. Each district office has an up to date list of vacancies in its own and in other areas. Finding specialists for professional employment, placing handicapped people in work and arranging employment for migrants are important aspects of the work, and play their part in building Australia’s future.

results.title: The Japanese garden
results.creator_credit: dentsu and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: Atmospheric shots of misty valleys begin this stylised look at the natural beauties of the Japanese countryside and traditional gardens. Shows use of water and stone ornaments in formal gardens. Oriental music provides a complimentary background. No commentary.

results.title: The Jamestown story
results.creator_credit: Karl Schiffman, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Document Associates
results.brief_description: Focuses on Jamestown, a community with a history of strikes and labor troubles. Discusses an innovative program of labor management and co-operation that brought Jamestown back from the edge of economic disaster. Includes interviews with workers on the shop floor as well as managers.

results.title: The Jackson years: towards civil war
results.creator_credit: Dennis Azzarella and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Concentrates on Andrew Jackson’s first four year term. Covers his quarrel with the National Banks; the treaties with the Cherokees which saw the setting-up of reservasions west of the Mississippi; his resolution of the South Carolina dispute with the Federal Government; and the gagging of John Q Adams on the subject of slavery.

results.title: The Jackson years: the new Americans
results.creator_credit: Dennis Azzarella and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Looks at Andrew Jackson’s life prior to his election to the US presidency in 1828. Uses Alexis de Tocqueville’s book, ‘Democracy in America’ and a stage play to highlight aspects of Jackson’s life, such as his duel with Dickenson; his days in the militia; and his eventual election as president.
